title: 108_hr1276
content: The Act is titled the "American Dream Downpayment Act" and amends the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to include a Downpayment Assistance Initiative. The Secretary may grant assistance to low-income families for homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families must be low-income and first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee. The Secretary provides downpayment assistance for single-family housing to low-income families who are first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee such as a policeman, fireman, or teacher. The Secretary offers downpayment assistance for low-income families, including those with uniformed employees, with income limits based on area median income. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a participating jurisdiction must include a description of grant use and a plan for targeted outreach to residents of public housing and other assisted families. The income limitation for eligibility is set at 150 percent of the area's median income, adjusted for family size. The Secretary shall allocate assistance under this section based on a formula considering a jurisdiction's need and commitment to homebuyer assistance, including minimum allocation amounts. The Secretary allocates assistance based on a formula considering a jurisdiction's need and commitment to homebuyer assistance, including minimum allocation amounts. If allocated amounts become available for reallocation, they can be reassigned to participating jurisdictions. The Secretary allocates assistance based on a formula considering jurisdiction's need and commitment to homebuyer assistance. If allocated amounts become available for reallocation, they can be reassigned to other participating jurisdictions according to the established formula. Grants under this section are not subject to the provisions of this title, except for specific requirements outlined in the section. Grants under this section are subject to specific provisions of title I, sections 215(b), 218, 219, 221, 223, 224, and 226(a) of this title, and subtitle F. Funds under this section are considered for assistance, and any reallocated funds are also accounted for accordingly. Subtitle F allows for relocation assistance and downpayment assistance. Additionally, administrative costs can be covered using funds from subtitle A. An authorization of $200,000,000 is allocated for fiscal years 2004 and 2005 to carry out this section. Authorization of $200,000,000 for fiscal years 2004 and 2005 is allocated for relocation and downpayment assistance under Subtitle F of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title.
